import MethodEndpoint from "@theme/ApiExplorer/MethodEndpoint";
import ParamsDetails from "@theme/ParamsDetails";

<Heading
  as={"h1"}
  className={"openapi__heading"}
  children={"Update Metrics for SLA"}
>
</Heading>

<MethodEndpoint
  method={"post"}
  path={"/api/v1.0/metrics/for/sla/{id}"}
  context={"endpoint"}
>
  
</MethodEndpoint>



Retrieves or recalculates SLA-related metrics for the specified SLA record, returning aggregated counts used for reporting and dashboard widgets. Use this endpoint after creating or updating an SLA, or when you need a fresh metrics snapshot for compliance reporting.

**Prerequisites**
1. **id** - Use [GET /api/v1.0/slas](/docs/api/slas/list-slas) to list SLAs and extract `Items[].SlaId`.

**Workflow Example**
1. List SLAs: [GET /api/v1.0/slas](/docs/api/slas/list-slas) -&gt; capture the target `SlaId`.
2. Refresh metrics: [POST /api/v1.0/metrics/for/sla/\{id\}](/docs/api/slas/create-metric-by-id) with the SLA UUID.
3. Use the response data to populate SLA dashboards or export metrics.

**Minimal Required Fields**: id (path).

<Heading
  id={"request"}
  as={"h2"}
  className={"openapi-tabs__heading"}
  children={"Request"}
>
</Heading>

  parameters={[{"name":"Client","in":"header","required":false,"example":"WebBrowser","schema":{"type":"string"}},{"name":"ProductId","in":"header","required":false,"example":0,"schema":{"type":"integer"}},{"name":"Authorization","in":"header","required":false,"example":"{{BasicAuth}}","schema":{"type":"string"}},{"name":"SiteId","in":"header","required":false,"example":"{{SiteId}}","schema":{"type":"string"}},{"name":"id","in":"path","required":true,"schema":{"type":"string","format":"uuid"},"description":"The id parameter"}]}
>
  
</ParamsDetails>

  body={undefined}
